Our Story

Four years ago a young french man set sails for Iceland to discover the country of ice and fire. In search of adventure and wanting to fit in with the vikings he ended up falling in love with a local. Without beard and blond hair the case seemed to be lost but that was without counting on his french touch to seduce her, after few nights getting to know each other she fell under his charm and as couch surfing goes he finally upgraded from the sofa!

Then fast forward, the next year is marked by numerous back and forth between France and Iceland, trying to build us as a couple despite a long distance relationship. Figuring out that we both share a passion for travelling (and mainly dying to finally live together) we decide to take off on a year long world trip across Asia and Africa. 24/7 on each others back, what a change! If we survive this we will not have any secrets anymore, and let's face it, it was not always easy but we made it and felt that we only grew stronger from this experience!

After that, it was time to finally settle down and we both made the decision to settle in beautiful Iceland to build our nest. Isolated in the Atlantic Ocean it was the perfect place to get our lives together and continue nurturing our relationship. Two years later, he finally proposed, a new chapter opens and we are both looking forward to share the first page with you all in December.

Warm-up Party

28.12.2016 at 7 PM

Sæta Svínið

Hafnarstraeti 1-3

It is time for the Frenchies and the Vikings to get to know each other! Come and join us for a fun night down town Reykjavik! Pub quiz will start at 8 PM.

The wedding

30.12.2016

We are both looking forward to celebrate our union and share this really special moment with our family and friends. The ceremony will take place at Dómkirkjan by Austurvöllur at 4:30 PM followed by the reception and a dinner at Iðnó at 5.15PM. Please bring your babelfish with you as there will be talks in Icelandic, French and English!

On a side note The church is warmed so no worries! We recommend bringing warm boots, coats, gloves and a hat for the two minutes walk over to Iðnó. Bringing heels in a bag is normal in Iceland, so no need to wear boots all night, unless you want to!

We have not signed up with any gift registry but we are saving for our honeymoon and an urn will be available at Iðnó.

New Years Eve

31.12.2016 at 6 PM

Bryggjan Brugghús

Grandagarður 8

We will celebrate New Years Eve at Bryggjan Brugghús, Brewery and Restaurant by the Reykjavik Harbor. They will put together a three course menu for us for 9.900 ISK (73 euros) per person. They have a phenomenal beer selection we recommend! Later we plan on shooting up fireworks and dancing the night away! Please send an email to trota.antoine@gmail.com for confirmation and let us know about any food allergies!

Travel & Accomodation

Car Rental

CheapJeep

SadCar

VikingCar

Thrifty

All other European agencies are also available (HERTZ, AVIS, etc...). If you plan to travel outside of the Reykjavik area and off the main roads we highly recommend to rent a 4x4. During the winter, roads are really often closed, please always check the road conditions before planning a trip.

Housing

AirBnB

Hotel Fron

Center Hotels

Foss Hotels

Hotels and Guest houses are really expensive in Iceland so we encourage that you use AirBnB for accomodation. The New Years period is one of the busiest of the year so we highly recommend that you book your accomodation as soon as possible.

In and Around Reykjavik

Wedding Related

Activities Around

Auroras

Northern Lights activity varies a lot and the lights can only be spotted if there are no clouds and the activity is quite good. Here is a link to the official Aurora Forecast website so you can be prepared for hunting while you will be in Iceland.
